alert.note: Alert for Blanco; Dimmit; Gillespie; Kendall; Llano (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 21 at 2:03PM CST until February 22 at 5:00PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Expected for the Rio Grande Plains, Southern Edwards Plateau and Hill Country Wednesday afternoon... .A dryline will sweep through South Central Texas Wednesday morning, resulting in west to west-southwesterly winds of 15 to 25 mph with higher gusts. In combination with minimum relative humidities of between 8 and 15 percent, critical fire weather conditions will be expected from late Wednesday morning through Wednesday afternoon across the Rio Grande Plains, Southern Edwards Plateau and Hill Country. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 5 PM CST WEDNESDAY FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS, SOUTHERN EDWARDS PLATEAU AND HILL COUNTRY... The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from 11 AM to 5 PM CST Wednesday. * WINDS...West-southwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...8 to 15 percent * IMPACTS...Any wildfires that develop could be difficult to control and will likely spread rapidly
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
